intro: Rinorea friisii, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Rinorea friisii is also notable for its hairy stems and leaves, which are adapted to its tropical habitat.
